For positive integers $n$, define $S_n$ to be the minimum value of the sum
\[\sum_{k=1}^n \sqrt{(2k-1)^2+a_k^2},\]where $a_1,a_2,\ldots,a_n$ are positive real numbers whose sum is $17$. Find the unique positive integer $n$ for which $S_n$ is also an integer.
inference:
Let $S_n=\sum_{k=1}^n \sqrt{(2k-1)^2+a_k^2}.$

Then,
\begin{align}
S_n^2=\left(\sum_{k=1}^n \sqrt{(2k-1)^2+a_k^2}\right)^2&=\sum_{k=1}^n \left((2k-1)^2+a_k^2\right)+2\sum_{1\le i<j\le n} \sqrt{\left((2i-1)^2+a_i^2\right)\left((2j-1)^2+a_j^2\right)}\\
&=\sum_{k=1}^n (4k^2-4k+2)+2\sum_{1\le i<j\le n} \sqrt{\left((2i-1)^2+a_i^2\right)\left((2j-1)^2+a_j^2\right)}.
\end{align}

Note that $\sum_{k=1}^n a_k=17$ and $a_k>0$ for all $k$, so $a_k\le 17$ for all $k$.  Thus,
\begin{align}
S_n^2&\le \sum_{k=1}^n (4k^2-4k+2)+2\sum_{1\le i<j\le n} \sqrt{17^2\cdot 17^2}\\
&= 4\sum_{k=1}^n k^2-4\sum_{k=1}^n k+2n+2\cdot \frac{n(n-1)}{2}\cdot 17^4\\
&=4\left(\frac{n(n+1)(2n+1)}{6}\right)-4\left(\frac{n(n+1)}{2}\right)+2n+289n^3-924n^2+1218n\\
&= \frac{4}{3}n^3+\frac{4}{3}n^2-\frac{8}{3}n+289n^3-924n^2+1218n\\
&=290n^3-920n^2+1210n.
\end{align}

Since $a_k>0$ for all $k$, $S_n>0$.  Thus, $S_n$ is an integer if and only if $S_n^2$ is an integer.  Thus, we want to find the unique positive integer $n$ for which $290n^3-920n^2+1210n$ is an integer.  Factoring, we obtain
$$290n^3-920n^2+1210n=10(29n^3-92n^2+121n).$$

The only positive integer $n$ for which $29n^3-92n^2+121n$ is an integer is $n=1$.  Thus, $S_n$ is an integer if and only if $n=1$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{1}.$ I hope it is correct.
